question: 切迫
partsOfSpeech: noun, する verb, の adjective
sourceMnemonic: We're <kanji>cut</kanji> right down to the end, reaching that <kanji>urge</kanji> position where <vocabulary>urgency</vocabulary> and <vocabulary>pressure</vocabulary> are so strong.
sourceReadingMnemonic: This is a jukugo word, which usually means on'yomi readings from the kanji. If you know the readings of your kanji you'll know how to read this as well. The <ja>せつ</ja> of <ja>切</ja> gets shortened to a small <ja>っ</ja>. The <ja>はく</ja> becomes <ja>ぱく</ja>.
